item.title: Victory Day and the republic we owe ourselves
item.description: December 16 returns each year as a solemn river of memory, carrying the sound of marching feet across muddy fields, the echo of gunfire, whispered prayers, and the tears of mothers who waited, uncertain whether their sons would return.

item.title: The war I never saw, but inherited
item.description: I belong to a generation that did not witness the Liberation War. The war, regardless, has meant a great deal to me for as long as I can remember.

item.title: The unhealed wounds of 1971: Bangladesh's unfinished liberation
item.description: The 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War was not merely a military conflict; it was a civilisational rupture that tore through the social fabric of an entire nation, leaving scars that have never properly healed.
